statement: Find all real roots of the equation √(x² − p) + 2√(x² − 1) = x, where p is a real parameter.
Point A and segment BC are given. Determine the locus of points in space that are vertices of right angles with one side passing through A and the other side intersecting segment BC.
In an n-gon all of whose interior angles are equal, the lengths of consecutive sides satisfy a₁ ≥ a₂ ≥ ⋯ ≥ aₙ. Prove that a₁ = a₂ = ⋯ = aₙ.
Find all solutions (x₁, x₂, x₃, x₄, x₅) of the cyclic system x₅ + x₂ = y x₁, x₁ + x₃ = y x₂, x₂ + x₄ = y x₃, x₃ + x₅ = y x₄, x₄ + x₁ = y x₅, where y is a real parameter.

Five students A, B, C, D, E took part in a contest. Prediction 1: ABCDE (no one in correct position, no consecutive pair correct). Prediction 2: DAECB (exactly two in correct positions, two disjoint consecutive pairs correct). Determine the actual finishing order.
